p: According to Gupta and Vasudeva [ 55], EOs from aerial parts showed high amounts of ( E)-anethole (76.9–87.5%) and methylchavicol (10.7–19.3%), in addition to variable amounts of ( Z)-anethole (tr–68.2%), and lower amounts of isomenthone (4.5%), menthone (4%), 1,8-cineole (1.5%), pulegone (1.1%), germacrene D (1%), bicyclogermacrene (1%), ( E, E)-α-farnesene (0.8%), cumin aldehyde (0.7%), and spathulenol (0.5%). An EO from Argentina [ 98] was characterized by only two molecules: ( E)-anethole (74.5%) and methylchavicol (23.7%). This chemical composition is uncharacteristic of Tagetes species, and is close to the specific chemotype of T. lucida, rich in ( E)-anethole.
